title: Association Evidence for Disorders to Phenotypes
description: Contains links to Disorders and Phenotypes that have associations from HPOA annotation file

using_id.title: The database ID in column 1 of the HPOA file

is_not.title: NOT Qualifier
is_not.description: If 'True' indicates that the disease in question is not characterized by the indicated HPO term. This is used to record phenotypic features that can be of special differential diagnostic utility.

evidence_code.title: Evidence code for the association
evidence_code.note: This required field indicates the level of evidence supporting the annotation. Annotations that have been extracted by parsing the Clinical Features sections of the omim.txt file are assigned the evidence code IEA (inferred from electronic annotation). Please note that you need to contact OMIM in order to reuse these annotations in other software products. Other codes include PCS for published clinical study. This should be used for information extracted from articles in the medical literature. Generally, annotations of this type will include the PubMed id of the published study in the DB_Reference field. ICE can be used for annotations based on individual clinical experience. This may be appropriate for disorders with a limited amount of published data. This must be accompanied by an entry in the DB:Reference field denoting the individual or center performing the annotation together with an identifier. For instance, GH:007 might be used to refer to the seventh such annotation made by a specialist from Gotham Hospital (assuming the prefix GH has been registered with the HPO). Finally we have TAS, which stands for “traceable author statement”, usually reviews or disease entries (e.g. OMIM) that only refers to the original publication.

frequency_term.title: Frequency Term
frequency_term.description: A term-id from the HPO-sub-ontology below the term Frequency.
frequency_term.comment: If there is a value in this field there should not be one in frequency_value and vice versa

frequency_value.title: Frequency Value
frequency_value.description: Either a count of patients affected within a cohort (example 7/13 indicates that in attribution, 7 of the 13 patients with the disorder have the phenotype or a percentage value such as 17%, again referring to the percent of patients with disorder with phenotype.
frequency_value.comment: If there is a value in this field there should not be one in frequency_term and vice versa

attribution_id.title: Attribution
attribution_id.description: source of the information used for the annotation. This may be the clinical experience of the annotator or may be taken from an article as indicated by a PubMed id.

onset.title: Onset
onset.description: A term-id from the HPO-sub-ontology below the term Age of onset.

affected_sex.title: Affected Sex
affected_sex.description: Used if the annotation in question is limited to males or females. This field refers to the phenotypic (and not the chromosomal) sex

modifier.title: Modifier
modifier.description: A term from the clinical modifier sub ontology

aspect.title: Aspect
aspect.description: one of P (Phenotypic abnormality), I (inheritance), C (onset and clinical course) or M (modifier).
